00013 void eol_loader_init()
00014 {
00015   PHYSFS_init(NULL);
00016   PHYSFS_mount("./", NULL, 1);
00017   _eol_loader_initialized = eolTrue;

00025 void eol_loader_add_search_path(char *filename,char *point)
00026 {
00027   if (!filename)return;
00028   if (!_eol_loader_initialized)return;
00029   PHYSFS_mount(filename,point, 1);
00030 }

00033 eolFile *eol_loader_write_file_binary(char *filename)
00034 {
00035   eolFile *file;
00036   if (!_eol_loader_initialized)
00037   {
00038     eol_logger_message(
00039         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00040         "eol_loader: not initialized\n"
00041       );
00042     return NULL;
00043   }
00044   if (filename == NULL)
00045   {
00046     eol_logger_message(
00047         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00048         "eol_loader: passed NULL data to load from object\n"
00049       );
00050     return NULL;
00051   }
00052   file = (eolFile *)malloc(sizeof(eolFile));
00053   if (file == NULL)
00054   {
00055     eol_logger_message(
00056         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00057         "eol_loader: unable to allocate eolFile handle\n"
00058       );
00059     return NULL;
00060   }
00061   memset(file,0,sizeof(eolFile));
00062   
00063   file->_PSfile = PHYSFS_openRead(filename);
00064   if(file->_PSfile == NULL)
00065   {
00066     eol_logger_message(
00067         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00068         "eol_loader:Unable to open file %s!\n",
00069         filename);
00070     free(file);
00071     return NULL;
00072   }
00073   file->_fileMode = eolLoaderWriteBinary;
00074   return file;
00075 }
00076 
00077 eolFile *eol_loader_read_file(char *filename)
00078 {
00079   eolFile *file;
00080   if (!_eol_loader_initialized)
00081   {
00082     eol_logger_message(
00083         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00084         "eol_loader: not initialized\n"
00085       );
00086     return NULL;
00087   }
00088   if (filename == NULL)
00089   {
00090     eol_logger_message(
00091         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00092         "eol_loader: passed NULL data to load from object\n"
00093       );
00094     return NULL;
00095   }
00096   file = (eolFile *)malloc(sizeof(eolFile));
00097   if (file == NULL)
00098   {
00099     eol_logger_message(
00100         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00101         "eol_loader: unable to allocate eolFile handle\n"
00102       );
00103     return NULL;
00104   }
00105 
00106   memset(file,0,sizeof(eolFile));
00107   file->_PSfile = PHYSFS_openRead(filename);
00108   if(file->_PSfile == NULL)
00109   {
00110     eol_logger_message(
00111         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00112         "eol_loader:Unable to open file %s!\n",
00113         filename);
00114     free(file);
00115     return NULL;
00116   }
00117   file->size = PHYSFS_fileLength(file->_PSfile);
00118   file->_buffer = (char *)malloc(file->size);
00119   if(file->_buffer == NULL)
00120   {
00121     eol_logger_message(
00122         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00123         "eol_loader:Unable to allocate space for %s file reading!\n",
00124         filename);
00125     PHYSFS_close(file->_PSfile);
00126     free(file);
00127     return NULL;
00128   }
00129   PHYSFS_read(file->_PSfile, file->_buffer, file->size, 1);
00130   file->file = fmemopen (file->_buffer, file->size, "r");
00131 
00132   if (!file->file)
00133   {
00134     eol_logger_message(
00135         EOL_LOG_ERROR,
00136         "eol_loader: failed to open file: %s\n",
00137         filename);
00138     PHYSFS_close(file->_PSfile);
00139     free(file->_buffer);
00140     free(file);
00141     return NULL;
00142   }
00143   file->_fileMode = eolLoaderRead;
00144   return file;
00145 }

00147 void eol_loader_close_file(eolFile **file)
00148 {
00149   if ((!file) ||
00150      (!*file))
00151   {
00152     return;
00153   }
00154   if ((*file)->file != NULL)
00155     fclose((*file)->file);
00156   if ((*file)->_PSfile != NULL)
00157     PHYSFS_close((*file)->_PSfile);
00158   if ((*file)->_buffer != NULL)
00159     free((*file)->_buffer);
00160   *file = NULL;
00161 }
00162 
00163 void eol_loader_write_uint_to_file(eolFile *file,eolUint data)
00164 {
00165   if (!file)return;
00166   if (file->_fileMode != eolLoaderWriteBinary)
00167   {
00168     eol_logger_message(
00169       EOL_LOG_WARN,
00170       "eol_loader:file not opened for writing\n");
00171     return;
00172   }
00173   if (EOLFILEENDIAN == EOLFILELISTTLEENDIAN)
00174   {
00175     PHYSFS_writeULE32(file->_PSfile, (PHYSFS_uint32) data);
00176   }
00177   else
00178   {
00179     PHYSFS_writeUBE32(file->_PSfile, (PHYSFS_uint32) data);
00180   }
00181 }
00182

00203 void eol_loader_write_line_to_file(eolFile *file,eolLine data)
00204 {
00205   int i;
00206   if (!file)return;
00207   if (file->_fileMode != eolLoaderWriteBinary)
00208   {
00209     eol_logger_message(
00210       EOL_LOG_WARN,
00211       "eol_loader:file not opened for writing\n");
00212     return;
00213   }
00214   for (i = 0;i < EOLLINELEN;i++)
00215   {
00216     if (EOLFILEENDIAN == EOLFILELISTTLEENDIAN)
00217     {
00218       PHYSFS_writeULE16(file->_PSfile, (PHYSFS_uint16) data[i]);
00219     }
00220     else
00221     {
00222       PHYSFS_writeUBE16(file->_PSfile, (PHYSFS_uint16) data[i]);
00223     }
00224   }
00225 }

00227 void eol_loader_write_string_to_file(eolFile *file,char * data)
00228 {
00229   int i;
00230   eolUint len;
00231   if ((!file) || (!data))return;
00232   if (file->_fileMode != eolLoaderWriteBinary)
00233   {
00234     eol_logger_message(
00235     EOL_LOG_WARN,
00236                        "eol_loader:file not opened for writing\n");
00237                        return;
00238   }
00239   len = strlen(data);
00240   /*prepend string lenth*/
00241   eol_loader_write_uint_to_file(file,len);
00242   for (i = 0;i < len;i++)
00243   {
00244     if (EOLFILEENDIAN == EOLFILELISTTLEENDIAN)
00245     {
00246       PHYSFS_writeULE16(file->_PSfile, (PHYSFS_uint16) data[i]);
00247     }
00248     else
00249     {
00250       PHYSFS_writeUBE16(file->_PSfile, (PHYSFS_uint16) data[i]);
00251     }
00252   }
00253 }
